reviews.review: Great Game
One of the best sequels ever made. It expands the story of the first one and then ends flawlessly.
Quirky, funny,plot-driven adventure game. Get it.
Amazing sequel to the original Portal

Portal 2 is an amazing game, if you havent played any of the Portal games then DO so. Portal is not only a more advance game over Portal 1, its got an actual story. ANd by mercy is that story amazing, its even linked to the Half Life world in wich you can find  easter eggs traces. 

Only neg thing, its too short for me :-(
And I thought that with multiplayer it would be more fun, but thanks to the TF2 buy-new-stuff system it kind of got bring pretty fast with limite maps and challages.
If you don't have this game already.... what are you doing? With a Metascore of 95, you'd be a fool not to get this game.

Portal 2 is nothing short of awesome. Normally sequels are worse but this one exceeds all expectations with the story continuing from the first game and new characters are introduced really well. The game gets even better when you play with a friend. The co-op add more challenges and puzzles - twice the fun with twice the portals!
Play it, its great!

Portal 2, or "how Single Player games should be made today". Featuring the best voice-overs in ages, stunning visuals, amazingly well-thought scenario and The portal gun, it kinda feels like actually going to space. I guess.
This game is really awesome!!!!

The sequel of the best game of 2007, Portal. It doesn't match the original because it's not a whole new experience and the claustrophobic is missing, but testing with GLaDOS and the new elements is plenty of fun, and there are lots of epic moments as you unfold the storyline. But the highlight is co-op, which is extremely fun and you'll definitely enjoy with a friend. Lots of hours of fine gaming moments and easily best game of 2011. Go buy it!
awesome game!
Quite simply one of the best games yet released by Valve. Get this game!

Definitely one of the best games I've ever played. Brilliant puzzles and some hilarious voice acting. Everyone should play this at least once. Just make sure you've played the first one before you do.
The best story line EVER!

A beautiful continuation of the first game.  Well scripted and well executed game with a few good twists and turns along the way.  Its not as challenging as the first, especially if a veteran of the first game, but still a good little puzzler.  Definitely the front runner for 2011 game of the year.
Recommended
Portals 2 is the best game you can be playing right now...

Portal 2 is just the amazingness that we saw in portal 1 but like... times 100. This game has a lot more rich environment and challenges that can really make you have to use your reflexes. Play this game!

If you liked Portal 1 then Portal 2 is an extension of the first game, but with far more depth and frustration. While the amount of ways puzzles can be solved seems to have been reduced in favor for more complex test chambers the non-linear exploration of Aperature Science and what beackons beneath it are a treat for anyone who enjoyed the first game or is just getting into the series for the first time.

Portal 2 takes everything that was great about the first Portal and makes it bigger and better. More, larger levels, more characters, more puzzle mechanics. With a constant (hilarious) narrative keeping everything going. You'll want to replay this many times just to hear your favourite jokes again.
Recommend
Play it, dont ask why JUST DO IT!!

Great music, great refinement, great gameplay, great story, great co-op. The only reason not to own this game is if you get nauseous from first-person games.

THE ONLY REASON.

This was a wonderful continuation of Portal and addition to the HL universe. Getting to see all the early days of Aperature, Listening to Cave Johnson and the overall depth the game takes you was so enjoyable. I admit I have yet to try multiplayer after all these years.

A great game.

Whether or not you've played the first one, Portal 2 not only brings back the goodies from the first game but a much longer, in-depth experience with new puzzles and totally new dynamics to add to an already fun game.  Great humor, great single and co-op, a great buy... GET PORTAL 2!

If you've never played Portal, you've missed out on an incredible gaming experience.  If you've played Portal, but you don't own Portal 2, then you've missed out on what may well be the best game of the year.

Portal 2 takes everything fun about Portal and then made that seem simplistic and elementary.  And then it challenges you to do the impossible again and again.  And when you've done six impossible things today...

Then you know you've played an incredible game.

Following the originality of the first Portal, this successor adds the much awaited co-op mode, not to mention a fantastically twisted continuation of the storyline! Get together with a (good) buddy and solve puzzles filled with Portal-induced gravitational goodness...and hope to the big guy upstairs your friend isn't feeing mischevious. 9/10

Fooking love this game. put a good 30 or 40 hours into it.
finished Co-op 5 times

If you liked Portal you will love its sequal.  Even though it has horrible console stylee loading screens, which totally break up the feel of the game.   As funny as the first but lame loading screens. 8/10
Improves upon the first in every way. Fun and engaging coop. I don't see how anyone could possibly not enjoy this game.

Don't rush the storyline!  Of course people will complain that it's too short if they rush through it.  There's actually a lot of painstaking details and secrets that the developers put in the singleplayer that you should really slow down and investigate - and I'm not just talking about the achievements only.

As for the purchasable DLCs, yes it's sucky that some stuff is by additional purchase only, a la TF2.  It's not what the entire game is about though.  Working and playing together with friends is a wonderful satisfaaction.  Would you really care about purchasable customizations that you'll never really get to show off that much?

If I were to reconsider this game, maybe $45 to $50 is pushing it in price, based on the replayability of this game - even after considering user created levels.  Difficulty is on par with the previous Portal.  Nevertheless it's an immersive singeplayer storyline and gameplay that's worth experiencing.

If you have a computer and a Steam account, it really is a no brainer...

GET THIS GAME!!!
Mto bom :]
As great as Portal 1, which was perfect.

A detailed quirky storyline taking you back into the world of Portal for another round of testing. Great single and multiplayer campaigns make this a fantastic entertainment value for puzzle shooter fans. Don't expect it to be very difficult though, guess that's what the DLC will be for.

The same cool portal gameplay we know, but with added puzzles, more story and co-op. Both this and the first are cool to play. But I suggest the first over the second.

Awesome sequal and would fully recommend it.

This is a game that can challenge for the best game of 2011, easily.  A great story with a (still) great gameplay concept.  With the original Portal you got what a group of talented people could do with a little help from Valve, this time around you have the full support of Valve and it shows.  While the Source engine is definitely aging, you ccan still do quite a bit with it and the graphics they are pulling out of it these days with Portal 2 are quite impressive considering its age.  Pick up this game if you like a game that will challenge your intellect and make you laugh at the same time.

A truly innovative game and a surefire improvement from the last, Portal two returns to the deep labs of Aperture Science, to find out it hasnt had anything happening for over a thousand years. You meet Wheatley, a partially corrupted core, who helps you find your way out. Unfortunately, you accendentally activate GLaDOS, the robot you killed in the first game. So, now shes out for revenge, but her duties to do testing for science have other plans. So now you must escape the facility and avoid GLaDOS' wrath.
its good.

Epic!
Intellectual, beautiful and at times hilarious. A true melding of storytelling and gameplay.
Clever gameplay, nice plot, hilarious characters, tricky multiplayer that will keep you occupied for hours.
If you have not played Portal 2 yet, You are a sub-human piece of garbage.
This game is so wonderfully crafted with humor, its a must play.
Portal 2 FTW!
SPAAAAAAAAACE

Portal 2 take everything that was fun in the first game and builds on it.  In fact, I would go so far to say that this game is one of my favorite games of all time. 

The gameplay is fun and clever, with less of a reliance on the more twitchy portal gun tricks. Which can be both a good and a bad thing depending on your tastes I suppose. 

The high point of the game is the interactions between the characters, and the dialoug and sense of humor in general.  The new character, "Wheatley" for instance is simply adorable. 

The basic flow of the game is paced well, so in general, you'll always feel a desire to keep on going. 

The co-op mode is also wonderful, funny, and gives a great feeling of accomplishment as  you go through. 

Anyways, if you hate fun, this game may not be for you. But for everyone else, PLAY IT!
I could waste this time talking about how awesome Portal 2 is, but I'd rather you'd buy it, and find out for yourself. That means I'm recommending it, for you to buy it, on Steam, now.
If you haven't picked up 2011's GotY yet, your brain must be broken!

Falling down a hole is usually a painful and embarassing experience, occasionally accompanied by death. There have been no documented deaths associated with Portal 2 related falling into holes. 

For this reason alone, you should buy Portal 2. Oh, and it's rather good by the way.
You should play it. For science!
